urls.title: Environment Agency pension fund invested in manufacturers of toxic weedkillers
urls.description: Environment Agency pension funds are invested in companies that make pesticides banned in the UK and Europe due to the harm they cause to bee populations.

tweets.text: New investigation - @EnvAgency (body in charge of monitoring chemical pollution in England) has pension funds with millions of pounds invested in agrochemical giants that make toxic pesticides (including some that are banned in UK) #divest https://t.co/NTgPkLzblb

@AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency There needs to be a better understanding of the problem at *source*. If we properly segregated surface water from roofs, patios, & drives via SUDs so as to exclude from foul sewers, then pumping stations & treatment works would rarely be inundated and overflow. Cheaper that way?
